task_text: [Public Health Policy][Comparative-Analysis] Compare peacekeeping-specific COVID-19 policies with national public-health measures in the WHO COVID-19 brief.

gold_end_state.summary: Peacekeeping policies focus on operational continuity, mission-specific infection control, and evacuation protocols tailored to field constraints, whereas national public-health measures in WHO guidance are broader (population-level surveillance, legal measures, and healthcare surge capacity); the comparison highlights the need to adapt general guidance to operational contexts with constrained logistics.

quiz.question: Which setting emphasizes medical evacuation planning and mission continuity?
Which guidance commonly addresses population-level surveillance and legal public-health measures?

arguments.text: Comparison of peacekeeping vs national WHO measures
